author: reshm
title: NFT Based Authentication
description: The NFTs potential to act as means of authentication similar to the OAuth 2.0 Framework is still not being used.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal want to use the properties of NFTs to enable an industry-standard protocol for authorization on the blockchain. An important problem (security) is identified by the proposers and they plan on solving it using the bricks laid in the ecosystem. As a developer I love this. It's clearly stated how this will benefit the cardano ecosystem and it's users in particular. There are clear metrics (one of the few projects that has them) and in sync with the challenge settings. The proposal will be able to scale with future challenges, based on their extensive experience.  There's a need for security now more than ever, and the fact the authors thought of a way to implement something that was already battle tested OAuth.2.0 just speaks to their level of skill and imagination. I have no concerns about the proposal, I recommend to vote for it with all the votes you have.
f6_assessments.q1: I managed to verify all the listed credentials in linked in and a few other places, so the proposers are legit and have the know-how available to bring the project to it's success. There are set team members that have collaborated together and have been already funded by the previous round. The budget is straightforward and broken down reasonably. There's a verifiable plan easy to understand and follow as an interested party. A realistic timetable for all the tasks that need to be done and worked on, along with explanation for each one makes for a good proposal. The plan for the implementation is not too technical so anyone can understand it, but it's not too simple so it shows it's value. Resources that would be needed for the implementation are mostly specifications and they're listed in the proposal. The technical aspects are well defined since the proposers are going to implement an already existing standard for authentication more or less. There will be challenges, but the proposers have mentioned them in the the proposal and have thought them through already. The project is in sync with what's already been done and it's ready to build on top of it. I love the proposal, good luck to you and see you at voting!
f6_assessments.q2: Authors will accommodate anyone interested in their project with a discord channel and with an open source github repository. That will allow any interested community members to follow the progress of the project in its building phase. The metrics and KPIs are not only present, but relevant, which is unfortunately more than I can say for many other proposals. The road map and milestones are pretty straightforward. The time table is definitive enough as well. The problem and solution are clearly defined.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal identifies the need for open source repo to demonstrate how NFTs can be used as authentication. This will ad value to the Cardano ecosystem by bringing lots of new transactions and use cases to the blockchain. The metrics of this project is aligned with the challenge in the sense of projects making use of the  repository. This project is able to scale well as it is open source and available for all to use.
f6_assessments.q1: The relevant skills and team is provided with links and backgrounds. They are well known and active members in the community. The budget is reasonable and broken down into identifiable items. It will take 3 month to complete the repo, which is achievable. They explain in detail the process of using the NFT as authentication from start to finish. They provided a diagram to visualize the process. Some technical details are also provided, and this idea has already been proven to work and won a Capstones Challenge award. The only risk they touch on is the changes Plutus will still go through and they mitigate this by keeping the repository up to date.
f6_assessments.q2: They provided a roadmap with milestones and KPIs making it easy to measure the progress and performance of this project. They identify the problem of an open source repo needed to bootstrap NFT authentication methods. They solve this by creating the repo and community to contribute to this repo and maintaining the repo as Plutus evolves.

f6_assessments.q0:
very interesting idea and proposal. Being myself a developer and used IdentityServer based openid connect and oauth2.0 authentications/authorisations, i can vouch for this idea 100%.

The idea fits in perfectly and might be ground breaking use case for NFTs. Almost everywhere we see right now google/FB etc based oauth mechanisms in place. These companies just provide their implementation of these standards and perhaps control also all the data in many ways.

An open source solution like this could open up a new paradigm to web3 or even at web2 and people can finally start seeing diverse use case for NFTs.

Full points from my side.
f6_assessments.q1:
From experience perspective i fully trust the team, the team has really good experience with Cardano eco system and also have contributed to developer eco system quite extensively.

The team details are public and as can be seen have good professional work experience in software engineering. Moreover,
The team members already has good knowledge on plutus programming (3rd position in cardano hackathon) and are not alien to it.

The plan presented has been split well, understandably two. months for Repo/documentation and Plutus SC and PAB implementation, as they will do the most heavy lifting for this implementation.

Also the budget outlined is well explained. Developers count and fund requested per developer is well under budget.

Overall all the criterion are met, hence full stars from my side.
f6_assessments.q2:
I strongly agree that the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

The deliverables are quite clear and since this is a pure implementation oriented proposal, and as a senior developer myself i totally agree that the roadmap is perfectly well outlined. 

The success metrics are provided for 3-6-12 months and KPIs are well written, so for auditing the success community can always keep the long term vision in mind.

Therefore, in my opinion community should not have any issue in auditing the progress and success of this proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: Accesss to cloud credits is a common benefit of accelerators and incubators, yet none of the other proposals have this as a talking point. Therefore I disagree with the assessor who states that this proposal does not fit into the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal outs forth the idea of creating open sourced software that would help developers in all areas. It is aiming to create a foundational tool for developers.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan could have more detail as well as more of a budget breakdown, but from the info provided it seems they have all the relevant experience to follow through with this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Thiis proposal would be improved if it was able to provide more details with the roadmap, milestones, KPIs, and budget. It does provide the required info, but the audit would be limited in scope with the little information provided. More details would give themselves wiggle room when determining the success as well.

f6_assessments.q0:

The proposers also provide KPIs that are aligned with this challenge and can help everyone measure the success clearly.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team info is shown in the proposal is outstanding talents that I believe they can make this project work well. This is not a too complex project, and the proposer also provides things that the project will deliver in detail. It's appreciated that all of the content is easy to get. 
About the budget, the proposer's required budget is sufficient and so much optimized for all tasks.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer provides a very detailed roadmap and their KPIs completely help to audit the development progress easily. 
The proposer also helps us acknowledge the problem standing and make a real case about how their solution act. 
The last thing I want the proposer to consider is the risk and obstacles in the development plan, for this type of project, most are about the timing and bug... Detecting those can help them avoid disruption.

solution: Develop and maintain an open source repository demonstrating how NFTs can be used to achieve OAuth 2.0 type authentication.
experience: Sr. Software Engineers, Plutus Pioneers, Gimbalabs PPBL veterans, CardStarter Hackathon and Plutus Pioneers Capstone Challenge Winners.
